verses.text: 多種皮膚病之條例耶和華對摩西和亞倫說：

words.note: Classical Chinese equivalent of '的'

verses.text: 「如果有人在皮肉上生了瘤，或癬，或火斑，後來皮肉變成了大痲風病症（本章病名多不能確定它們的學名。傳統翻譯作「痲風」的希伯來字，本章用來形容不同的皮膚病症），就要把他帶到一個作祭司的亞倫子孫那裡。

words.note: Specific skin lesion in biblical context.
A specific biblical medical term encompassing various skin conditions.

words.definition: used to, for the purpose of

verses.text: 祭司要察看皮肉上的病症；如果患處的毛已經變白（「變白」或譯：「較其他皮肉色澤顯然為深」），病症的現象又深透皮下的肉，就是大痲風病症，祭司發現這樣，就要宣布他為不潔淨。

words.note: A specific biblical medical term encompassing various skin conditions.

verses.text: 火斑若是在他的皮肉上發白，但沒有深透皮膚的現象，上面的毛也沒有變白，祭司就要把患者隔離七天。

words.note: Specific skin lesion in biblical context.

verses.text: 到了第七天，祭司要察看他，如果看見病情止住了，皮上的患處沒有蔓延，祭司還要把他再隔離七天。

words.definition: when it reaches, by the time

verses.text: 到了第七天，祭司要再察看他；如果看見患處色澤變淡，也沒有在皮上蔓延，祭司就要宣布他為潔淨，這不過是癬；他洗淨衣服，就得潔淨了。

words.note: Refers to the site of illness or wound.
Often used in a ritual or moral sense.
Implies 'nothing more than'.
Refers to fungal skin infections; here, a milder affliction.
Often used in a ritual or moral sense.

verses.text: 但是祭司察看，宣布他潔淨以後，癬若是在皮上蔓延，他就要再次給祭司察看。

words.note: Often used in a ritual or moral sense.
Refers to fungal skin infections; here, a milder affliction.
More formal than '如果'.

verses.text: 祭司要察看他；如果發現癬在皮上蔓延了，祭司就要宣布他為不潔淨；這是大痲風。

words.note: Refers to fungal skin infections; here, a milder affliction.
Ancient term for various severe skin diseases.

verses.text: 「如果有人感染到大痲風，就要帶他到祭司那裡。

words.note: Ancient term for various severe skin diseases.

verses.text: 祭司要察看，如果發現皮上有白色浮腫，毛已經變白，患處的肉紅腫，

words.note: Refers to the site of illness or wound.

verses.text: 這就是皮肉上的潛伏性痲風病發作，祭司要宣布他為不潔淨；不必隔離觀察，因為他已經不潔淨。

words.note: A disease causing numbness and skin lesions.
Used with '不' to mean 'unclean'.
Used with '不' to mean 'unclean'.

verses.text: 如果祭司認為痲風病已在皮上蔓延，從頭到腳遮滿了患病者全身的皮，
那麼祭司就要察看；如果看見痲風布滿了他的全身，祭司就要宣布那患病者為潔淨；因為全身變白，就算是潔淨。

words.note: Short form of 痲風病 (leprosy).

verses.text: 但他身上甚麼時候出現紅腫的肉，他就成為不潔淨。

words.note: Used with '不' to mean 'unclean'.

verses.text: 祭司發現那紅腫的肉，就要宣布他為不潔淨；紅腫的肉原來是不潔淨的，是痲風病。

words.note: Used with '不' to mean 'unclean'.
Used with '不' to mean 'unclean'.

verses.text: 但紅腫的肉若是再復原，又變成白，他就要到祭司那裡，

words.note: Lit. 'one who manages sacrifices'.

verses.text: 祭司要察看；如果看見患處變白了，祭司就要宣布那患病者為潔淨的；他就潔淨了。

words.note: Refers to ritual purity in biblical context.

verses.text: 「人若是在皮肉上生了瘡，已經醫好了；

words.note: Locative suffix.

verses.text: 但在長瘡之處又起了白色浮腫，或是白中帶紅的火斑，他就要給祭司察看。

words.note: Classical equivalent of '的'.
Refers to a specific type of inflamed skin lesion.
Indicates a passive construction: 'to be given to'.

verses.text: 祭司要察看；如果發現有深透皮膚的現象，上面的毛也變白了，祭司就要宣布他為不潔淨；這就是在瘡中發作出來的痲風病。

words.note: Refers to ritual impurity in biblical context.
A directional verb complement.
Ancient term for a range of skin diseases, including what is now called Hansen's disease.

verses.text: 但如果祭司察看病情，看見上面沒有白毛，也沒有深透皮膚，只是發暗而已，祭司就要把他隔離七天；

words.note: Used at the end of a sentence to indicate 'that's all'.

verses.text: 如果在皮膚上蔓延，祭司就要宣布他為不潔淨；這就是痲風病。

words.note: Used after a noun to indicate location 'on the surface'.

verses.text: 火斑若是在原處止住，沒有蔓延，就是瘡的疤痕，祭司就要宣布他為潔淨。

words.note: Refers to a specific type of skin lesion in Levitical law.

verses.text: 「如果人的皮肉發炎，發炎紅腫的肉成了火斑，白中帶紅，或是純白，
祭司就要察看病情；如果發現火斑中的毛變白了，又有深透皮膚的現象，這就是從發炎發作出來的痲風病。祭司就要宣布他為不潔淨；這是痲風病。

words.note: Directional complement indicating emergence.

verses.text: 但如果祭司察看病情，看見火斑中沒有白毛，也沒有深透皮膚，只是發暗而已，祭司就要把他隔離七天。

words.note: A religious official in ancient times.
Refers to a specific type of skin lesion in Levitical law.

verses.text: 到了第七天，祭司要察看；火斑若是在皮上蔓延，祭司就要宣布他為不潔淨，這是痲風病。

words.note: Classical usage meaning 'to consider as' or 'to be'.
Often used in biblical contexts to mean ritually impure.
A general term for various severe skin diseases in the Bible.

verses.text: 火斑若是在原處止住，沒有在皮上蔓延，只是發暗而已，這是發炎腫瘤，祭司就要宣布他為潔淨，因為這只是發炎的疤痕。

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts to mean ritually pure.

verses.text: 「無論男女，如果在頭上或是鬍鬚上受到感染，
祭司要察看那病；如果發現有深透皮膚的現象，而且還有黃色細毛，祭司就要宣布他為不潔淨，這是癩痢，是頭上或是鬍鬚上的痲風病。

words.note: A specific type of skin disease, often involving scalp or beard, described in Levitical law.

verses.text: 祭司察看癩痢的患處；如果看見沒有深透皮膚的現象，那裡也沒有黑毛，祭司就要把那患癩痢的人隔離七天。

words.note: One who manages sacrifices or religious rites.
Refers to a severe, contagious skin disease in ancient texts.

verses.text: 到了第七天，祭司要察看患處；如果看見癩痢沒有蔓延，那裡也沒有黃毛，癩痢也沒有深透皮膚的現象，
那人就要剃去鬚髮，患癩痢的地方卻不可剃；祭司要把那患癩痢的人再隔離七天。

words.note: Refers to both facial and head hair, often in religious contexts.

verses.text: 到了第七天，祭司要再察看那癩痢；如果看見癩痢在皮上沒有蔓延，也沒有深透皮膚的現象，祭司就要宣布他為潔淨；他洗淨衣服，就潔淨了。

words.note: Carries connotations of ritual purity.
Refers to ritual washing for purity.

verses.text: 但是他得潔淨以後，癩痢若是在皮上蔓延，

words.note: More formal or literary than '如果'.

verses.text: 祭司就要察看；如果發現癩痢在皮上蔓延，祭司不必找黃毛，他已經不潔淨。

words.note: An official managing sacrificial rites.
An older term for leprosy; 麻風 (máfēng) is more common today.
A specific symptom mentioned in Levitical law.
Refers to ritual purity in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 如果祭司認為，癩痢已經止住，那裡也長了黑毛；癩痢已經痊愈，那人就潔淨了，祭司要宣布他為潔淨。

words.note: 住 (zhù) acts as a resultative complement, indicating stability.
A specific sign of healing in Levitical law.

verses.text: 「無論男女，皮肉上若是起了斑點，白色的斑點，

words.note: Often used in a formal or literary context.

verses.text: 祭司就要察看；如果發現斑點在皮肉上呈灰白色，這是皮膚出疹，那人是潔淨的。

words.note: More formal than 顯現 (xiǎnxiàn) to describe appearance.

verses.text: 「人的頭髮若是掉下了，只不過是禿頭，還是潔淨的。
人的頭頂上若是掉下了頭髮，只不過是禿額，他還是潔淨的。

words.note: Refers to ritual purity

verses.text: 但是頭頂禿處或是額前禿處，若有白中帶紅的病症，這就是痲風病，在他的頭頂禿處或是額前處發作。

words.note: Describes the specific color of the lesion
Ancient term for various skin diseases, not just modern leprosy.

verses.text: 祭司就要察看，如果發現在他頭頂禿處或是額前禿處，有白中帶紅的浮腫病症，像皮肉上痲風病的現象，

words.note: Describes the specific color of the lesion
Ancient term for various skin diseases, not just modern leprosy.

verses.text: 那人就是患了痲風病，就不潔淨；祭司要宣布他為不潔淨，那人頭上染了痲風。

words.note: Ancient term for various skin diseases, not just modern leprosy.
Refers to ritual impurity
Refers to ritual impurity
Ancient term for various skin diseases, not just modern leprosy.

verses.text: 「身上患有痲風病的人，要撕裂自己的衣服，披頭散髮，遮蓋上唇喊叫：『不潔淨！不潔淨！』

words.note: Ancient term for various skin diseases, not just modern leprosy.
An idiom describing messy, unbound hair.
Refers to ritual impurity
Refers to ritual impurity

verses.text: 在他患病的日子裡，他是不潔淨的；他既然不潔淨，就要獨居，住在營外。

words.note: Often implies ceremonial purity in biblical context.

verses.text: 有關患痲風病人衣服之條例「染了痲風病的衣服，無論是羊毛衣服或是麻布衣服；

words.note: Ancient disease, often translated as leprosy.
Classical equivalent of 的.

verses.text: 不論是編結的或是紡織的；是麻布的或是羊毛的；是皮子或是皮子做成的任何物件；
病症若是在衣服或皮子、編結物或紡織物，或任何皮子做成的器具上發綠或發紅，那就是發霉（「發霉」與「惡性皮膚病」是同一希伯來字）的現象，要給祭司察看。
祭司要察看那現象，把染了病症之物隔離七天。
到了第七天，祭司要察看那病症；如果那病症在衣服、編結物、紡織物、皮子，或是任何皮子做成的物件上蔓延，這就是頑惡的霉，那件物件就不潔淨了。

words.note: One who manages sacrifices or sacred rites.
Refers to items made by knitting or knotting.
Describes a persistent and destructive evil or disease.
Often refers to ritual purity or cleanliness in a religious sense.

verses.text: 染上病症的衣服，無論是編結的或是紡織的，是羊毛或是麻布，或任何皮子做的物件，都要燒掉。因為那是頑惡的霉，所以要用火燒掉。

words.note: Refers to fabric made from hemp, often used for humble clothing or sackcloth in biblical contexts.
Describes a persistent and destructive evil or disease.

verses.text: 「但如果祭司察看病症，在衣服、編結物、紡織物，或是皮子做的任何物件上，沒有蔓延，

words.note: One who manages sacrifices or sacred rites.
Refers to items made by knitting or knotting.

verses.text: 祭司就要吩咐人把它洗淨，然後再隔離七天。

words.note: One who manages sacrifices or sacred rites.
Marks the object of a verb, placing it before the verb.

verses.text: 洗淨以後，祭司要察看；如果看見那病症沒有轉變，雖然沒有蔓延，那物件仍是不潔淨；要用火把它燒掉，因為裡外都腐蝕了。

words.note: One who manages sacrifices or sacred rites.
Often refers to ritual purity or cleanliness in a religious sense.
Marks the object of a verb, placing it before the verb.

verses.text: 「但如果祭司察看的時候，看見它洗淨以後，色澤暗淡了，就要把那部分從衣服或是皮子、編結物或紡織物上撕下來。

words.note: Refers to specific woven materials in biblical law contexts.

verses.text: 如果病症再出現在剩下的衣服、編結物、紡織物或任何皮子做的物件上，那就是病症仍然發作，染了病症的物件，要用火燒掉。
如果病症離開了，經過洗淨，剩下的衣服，無論編結的或是紡織的，或任何皮子做的物件，只要再洗一次，就潔淨了。」

words.note: Used here as an adjective, related to woven items in Levitical law.
Often used in the context of ritual or ceremonial purity in the Bible.

verses.text: 以上是與羊毛衣服或是麻布衣服、編結的或紡織的或任何皮子做的物件有關的發霉律例，可以斷定潔淨，或是不潔淨。

words.note: Refers to religious or moral laws, particularly in a biblical context.
Often used in the context of ritual or ceremonial purity in the Bible.
Used here in the sense of ceremonial impurity.
